intro: Gompholobium furcellatum, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia and South Australia. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, often blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and trifoliate, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
